section.heading: Official amphibian of the District of Columbia.

para.text: The red-backed salamander (Plethodon cinereus) is a species of salamander in the class of amphibians found throughout the eastern and Appalachian regions of the United States, including in most wooded areas in the District of Columbia.
Red-backed salamanders eat insects, which helps control pests and maintain the balance of the ecosystem.

The red-backed salamander is increasingly recognized as a model organism for a variety of biological subdisciplines, including terrestrial ecology, amphibian ecology, evolutionary biology, regeneration, ecotoxicology, and animal behavior, in part due to its ubiquity and abundance throughout northeastern North America
The red-backed salamander (Plethodon cinereus) is hereby designated the official amphibian of the District of Columbia.
